Job Description:
Pay Transparency Statement:
The compensation philosophy reflects the Company’s reasonable expectation at the time of posting. We consider a number of factors when making individual compensation decisions including, but not limited to, skill sets, experience and training, and other business needs. This role may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary incentive program, subject to the rule governing the program.
Position Summary:
The Data Scientist is part of a Global Data and Analytics Center of Excellence, which provides design, development, consulting, and support services to various international markets. The Data Scientist will analyze data to identify relevant patterns and trends that can be leveraged to improve our business. Using these insights, the role will develop and implement advanced analytics solutions that deliver significant cost savings and/or drive new business opportunities for the organization.
Position Responsibilities may include, but not limited to: predictive models, AI/ML, streaming, Azure, Snowflake, Power BI, Spark, R, Python, Scala, SPSS, SAS, business intelligence, analytics, data science
Build and use business subject matter expertise around domains of data through heavy collaboration with business subject matter experts. Develop a thorough understanding of business challenges and business opportunities that can be addressed through analytics solutions
Determine valuable data sources and consolidate data from multiple sources into comprehensive datasets
Apply advanced statistical analysis to discover patterns and trends in large and complex datasets that can be used to uncover key business insights
Develop advanced statistical models, using appropriate statistical techniques and analytics tools and technologies such as Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence
Work in accordance with an iterative development process that allows for continual refinement and validation of analytics solutions
Present relevant analytical insights to business and project teams and make informed proposals for how to properly interpret and use this information
Identify appropriate technical approaches and tools to build and execute models
Work closely with other business and technical teams to operationalize and integrate analytical solutions into existing business and customer-facing applications
Balance the constraints of cost, time, and quality to deliver viable and practical solutions
Participate in Martin Brower global data governance processes to ensure data is both managed and used consistently and is compliant with enterprise standards
Other projects or duties as assigned
Required Skills and Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree with 4+ years of related technical experience
Strong technical orientation with experience modeling, cleansing, transforming, and analyzing large sets of data
Applied knowledge of modern analytics concepts, tools, and solution architectures
Capability to identify appropriate use cases for advanced analytics applications (predictive models, AI/ML, streaming analytics)
Demonstrated knowledge and real-world application of analytics platforms and technologies including, but not limited to, Microsoft Azure, Snowflake, Power BI
Demonstrated experience understanding and using common industry standard statistical analysis programming languages and packages such as Spark, R, Python, Scala, SPSS and SAS
Ability to apply critical thinking and problem-solving skills to the analysis and interpretation of data
At least 4 years of experience in a business intelligence, analytics or data science role within a global or multinational organization, in which the following occurred:
Designed and implemented multiple advanced analytics solutions (predictive, prescriptive, machine learning, etc…)
Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an iterative and agile development environment
Worked as a member of a formal analytics team or related business functional group
Developed and implemented integrated global analytics solutions across multiple countries/markets
Developed subject matter expertise to the point of being sought out for information and advice in the analytics domain
Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills with proven ability to develop collaborative and lasting working relationships with business stakeholders
Proven ability to collaborate with IT and business teams working at remote locations
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate technical subjects to non-technical audiences
Ability to travel as needed for projects. Estimated to be no more than 10% per year
This position must pass a post-offer background and drug test
Preferred Skills and Experience:
Post graduate degree in Engineering, Advanced Statistics, Computer Science, or related field
Technical Certification in Data Engineering, Data Architecture and/or Data Science
Experience within the distribution or Food Service industry
Physical Demands and Work Environment:
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Due to the nature of our business in regard to such things as delivery schedules, order inputs, selection, and Department of Transportation Hours of Service, overtime, attendance and punctuality are essential job functions. Should an individual in this classification not be able to adhere to this requirement due to a disability, they should contact their Human Resources department to see what, if any, reasonable accommodation may be made.

DataAnnotation is committed to creating quality AI. Join our team to help train AI chatbots while gaining the flexibility of remote work and choosing your own schedule.

We are looking for a proficient programmer to join our team to train our AI chatbots to code. You will work with the chatbots that we are building in order to measure their progress, as well as write and evaluate code.

In this role you will need to be proficient in at least one programming language (Python, JavaScript, HTML, C++, C# and SQL) and able to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.

Benefits:

This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position
You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on
You can work on your own schedule
Projects are paid hourly, starting at $30 USD per hour, with bonuses for high-quality and high-volume work

Responsibilities:

Come up with diverse problems and solutions for a coding chatbot
Write high-quality answers and code snippets
Evaluate code quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance

Qualifications:

Fluency in English (native or bilingual)
Proficient in at least one programming language (Python, JavaScript, HTML, C++, C# and SQL)
Excellent writing and grammar skills
A bachelor's degree (completed or in progress)
Previous experience as a Software Developer, Coder, Software Engineer, or Programmer

Note: Data Annotation payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD. If you are applying from any country outside of the US, Canada, the UK, Ireland, Australia, or New Zealand and sign up, please note that you will NOT receive a link as we are NOT taking applicants outside of those countries at this time. If you are applying from within those countries, it is possible to experience a 2 week delay, as we are currently receiving a significant number of applications, and work and pay can fluctuate based on project availability and the skillsets found in the assessment.

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $30.00 per hour

Expected hours: 1 – 40 per week

Schedule:

Choose your own hours

Work Location: Remote

Job Title: Data Scientist – Global Planning & Analytics, Analytics & Insights
Job Description:
Overview:

Talented and motivated individual who will be part of a group of skilled analytic resources to develop descriptive, diagnostic, predictive business solutions and deliver actionable insights to our internal and external customers.
The person will be responsible for applying cutting edge analytics to solve our clients’ complex problems in areas such as promotions, supply and demand planning, item/menu level analytics, supply chain simulations and optimization, competitive benchmarking, and root cause analysis.
The role will involve developing advanced analytic solutions in a modular way to ensure extensibility, scalability, and agility.
This will involve keeping up to date with the latest advances in data and analytics, which will then be used to inform the solution strategy. Ensuring high quality of the deliverables will be an essential part of this role.
This role provides the opportunity to shape our thinking on how analytic solutions are designed, developed, and delivered. The person must be able to synthesize data into actionable insights and promote data driven strategies, drive thought leadership, and help build a trusted partnership with stakeholders.
Be current on trends and developments in the market with an eye on bringing in new advancements into our portfolio of solutions.
This role will be part of the Global Planning & Analytics, Analytics and Insights team.
Responsibilities:
WHAT YOU WILL DO


Responsible for working with the Data & Operations, Innovation & Optimization and Integrated Planning teams to design and implement advanced algorithms to solve supply chain problems such demand and supply planning, replenishment, pricing and optimization
Create, develop, and implement innovative approaches to address the most relevant supply chain issues in the food service industry
Design and implement modular and scalable Data Science solutions with diagnostic, predictive and predictive capabilities that can be leveraged across product families
Monitor and adapt models to changing business needs
Working with Technology to ensure that any new solution is consistent and aligned with agreed architecture and infrastructure
Perform descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive analysis
Be an analytics translator to various levels of the organization and as an owner of complex analytics modules
Codify the appropriate analytic capabilities in a reusable and scalable manner to enable ease of consumption by other analytics developers
Act as a trusted advisor on machine learning, AI and statistical methods; enable other team members to solve complex data science problems, including problem formulation, data preparation, model development, and output interpretation


Desired Skills & Experience:
ABOUT YOU

Qualification
Bachelor’s degree in data science, analytics, statistics, operations research, engineering or closely related field; Master’s or Ph. D in quantitative field preferred.

Knowledge and Experience
3+ years of data science, analytics, business intelligence experience with Bachelor’s degree
Strong background in Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence and advanced statistical methods
Strong experience building and implementing ML/AI, statistical and simulation models
Strong experience in building scalable and maintainable Data Science/analytics solutions in Python
Comfortable handling large volumes as well as less than perfect data
Experience with advanced analytic and BI tools such as PowerBI and Tableau
Skilled in problem solving, data mining and analysis in a business setting
Domain knowledge in food service, restaurant operations, demand planning, supply planning, distribution and logistics a plus
Benefits:

TOTAL REWARDS

Our total rewards philosophy integrates programs for compensation, benefits, recognition, learning and development, corporate culture, corporate citizenship and work-life balance. While individual program components may differ by country, some things remain constant:

our commitment to rewarding results
opportunities to work with talented and driven individuals at every level of our company who respect each other, treat each other fairly and hold one another accountable for our customers’—and our company’s—success

There's more ...

inclusive employee resource groups
generous medical, dental, vision and other great benefits
paid parental and medical leave programs
401(k) with a company match component and profit sharing
15 days of paid time off plus company holidays
Hybrid work model with flexibility
tuition reimbursement and student loan repayment assistance

With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day & We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.

Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.

Job Description:

At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover is a great place to work. Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.

Responsible for working closely with management to execute analytical initiatives. Responsible for providing thought leadership & strategic thinking to solve business problems by leveraging techniques such as segmentation, optimization, advanced analytics and machine learning. This position will closely monitor performance metrics and KPIs to ensure goals are met and course correct as necessary.

Responsibilities

Provides thought leadership & strategic thinking to translate business problem into analytical framework(s), and independently recommend actions and provide business insights. Operates as a subject matter expert on statistical analysis, test and design of experiment, analysis methodology, modeling & application, and financial impact analysis.
Collaborates with cross-functional partners to understand their business needs, formulate and complete end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables and presentations. Facilitate implementation of work product and ensure accuracy. Establishes and maintains effective performance tracking; identifies improvement opportunity, form hypothesis, propose, design and implement tests to drive strategy enhancement and optimization.
Leads the development and implementation of advanced analytics including customer segmentation, optimization, prescriptive analytics and machine learning algorithm & recommendation to solve business problems. Lead the development of Analytical capabilities with the aim of creating long-term strategic data/analytics assets for the company.
Delivers effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of leadership, creating visual displays of quantitative information.
Develops and automates reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for analytical needs.
Consistently follows standard work processes and documentation requirements. Recommends improvement to work processes to increase efficiency while maintaining quality of work. Continuously improves technical and leadership skills through training and development.

Minimum Qualifications

At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Economics, Engineering, Sciences or related field
6+ years of experience in Credit Risk, Fraud Risk, Marketing Analytics, Optimization, Operations Analytics, Modeling/Data Science or related field

Preferred Qualifications

If we had our say, we’d also look for:

Master’s Degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Sciences or related field
4+ years of experience in Credit Risk, Fraud Risk, Marketing Analytics, Optimization, Operations Analytics, Modeling/Data Science or related field

Compensation:

The base pay for this position generally ranges between $123,500.00 to $173,100.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.

Paid Time Off

Medical, Dental, Vision, & Health Savings Account

STD, Life, LTD and AD&D

Recognition Program

Education Assistance

Commuter Benefits

Family Support Programs

Job Title: Sr Dir Data Science - Head of AI Innovation Lab
Job Description:
At HCSC, we consider our employees the cornerstone of our business and the foundation to our success. We enable employees to craft their career with curated development plans that set their learning path to a rewarding and fulfilling career.

Come join us and be part of a purpose driven company who is invested in your future!

Job Summary

HCSC is recruiting for a leader of our AI Innovation Lab. The Lab is tasked with exploration of cutting-edge AI technology (notably, generative AI), and helping HCSC realize value through application to practical business problems. The Senior Director will be responsible for executing proof-of-concept exercises, scaling solutions to meet business needs, and managing collaborative partnerships with external stakeholders.

This role is situated within the Data Science & AI Solutions team at HCSC, the central hub of data science work within the organization. Join our team of driven, fun, and accomplished builders, and help us advance HCSC’s mission: to do everything in our power to support our members, in sickness and in health.

Job Responsibilities:

Develop and implement strategic plans for the AI Innovation Lab, aligning with the organization's objectives.
Lead a team of data scientists to design and validate AI solutions in collaboration with product managers, engineers, and stakeholders.
Apply advanced AI methods, including generative AI models, to solve business problems using data from internal and external sources.
Provide strategic guidance informed by data and AI models to advise the business on addressing issues and capitalizing on opportunities.
Ensure policies and procedures align with the corporate vision and industry best practices.
Foster effective communication and collaboration within the team, stakeholders, and management.
Recruit, develop, and evaluate personnel to ensure the efficient operation of the AI Innovation Lab.
Serve as a liaison and support effective communication and strategy between the team and stakeholders.
Oversee the budget and operations of the AI Innovation Lab, ensuring efficient resource allocation and alignment with goals.

Required Job Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree and 7 years of work experience in a mathematical, statistical, computer science, engineering, physics, economics, or related quantitative field; OR 2 or more advanced degrees and 6 years of work experience in a mathematical, statistical, computer science, engineering, physics, economics, or related quantitative field; OR Ph.D. and 4 years of work experience in a mathematical, statistical, computer science, engineering, physics, economics, or related quantitative field; OR 11 years of work experience in an advanced mathematical, statistical, engineering, physics, or related quantitative field.
Experience with generative AI technologies.
Leadership and/or management experience.
4 years of management experience.
Strong learning and growth mindset.
Customer-focused approach.
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.
Experience in at least five of the following areas: data analysis and relational-style query languages; machine learning and/or statistical modeling; data visualization; a high-level programming language; distributed computing; understanding of healthcare.
Proficiency in Microsoft applications, including Access, Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
Demonstrated track record of independently delivering or leading complex analytics or data science projects.
Experience mentoring, managing, or leading analytics or data science staff.

Preferred Job Qualifications:

Master's or Ph.D. in a quantitative field, or Bachelor's degree with healthcare experience.
Experience with cloud-based cognitive services and cloud devops concepts.

Overview:
This is a hybrid position and will require working in our central office located in Oakbrook Terrace, IL. Typically requiring 2-4 days per month and as needed.


Collaborates with various departments to provide expertise in statistical analysis and data modeling, specifically focused on healthcare quality and safety data. Supports research and other project teams to identify and define key performance indicators, design statistical models, and perform advanced analyses to uncover trends and patterns in healthcare data. Responsibilities also include validating models, developing data collection strategies, and providing expert guidance in interpreting and communicating statistical findings to stakeholders. Guides and reviews the statistical methods and deliverables for the data analysts and data scientists within the research and quality measurement departments. Uses data visualization programs, tools, and techniques to generate dashboards, reports, and presentations that aid in data storytelling, understanding, and interpretation of trends and patterns of business importance.

Responsibilities:
Design and perform advanced statistical analyses, such as regression models, time series analysis, survival analysis, and data clustering, to identify trends, patterns, and correlations in healthcare data. Support internal research and project teams to provide statistical analysis plans needed for research proposals and manuscript development of peer-reviewed research publications. (40%)
Design and develop statistical models and methodologies for analyzing healthcare organization data to support quality measure development, quality measure pilot testing and analysis of quality measure data to support accreditation and certification operations. Includes outlier analysis and development of novel methods to identify performance patterns among healthcare organizations, and development/maintenance of risk-adjustment models to process healthcare organization outcome performance measures. (25%)
Evaluate and validate statistical models and analytical methods to ensure the reliability and robustness of results needed to support national measure endorsement and re-endorsement. (5%)
Provide expert guidance and support to stakeholders in interpreting and communicating statistical findings, including the presentation of results to executive leadership and external stakeholders. (10%)
Collaborate with data scientists and IT professionals to develop data management systems and tools for efficient data collection, storage, and retrieval. Mentor and provide guidance to data scientists and analysts, fostering their professional growth and development. (10%)
Stay updated with the latest advancements in statistical methodologies, healthcare regulations, and quality improvement initiatives, and integrate them into the organization's practices and processes. (5%)
Regularly communicate with project leaders. In collaboration with the project teams, maintain project work plans, maintain documentation of statistical support, and contribute to organization and upkeep of project files. (5%)
Qualifications:
The level of knowledge equivalent to that ordinarily acquired through the completion of doctoral degree in Statistics, Biostatistics, Epidemiology, or a related field.
7-10 years’ experience working as a Statistician or Data Scientist in the healthcare industry, with a focus on quality improvement, patient safety, or healthcare outcomes. Strong expertise in statistical analysis techniques and methodologies, including regression models, time series analysis, survival analysis, and data clustering. Advanced technical or statistical experience in all phases of relational database development and quality assurance (e.g., requirements, analysis, design, testing, implementation, documentation, maintenance).
Proficiency in statistical software, such as R or Python, for data manipulation, modeling, and visualization. Experience with relational databases, reporting/query tools, and software packages that The Joint Commission utilizes (e.g., MS Azure, MS Excel, MS Access, Power BI etc.). Displays a willingness to keep current on database technology, programming languages, and best practices.
Solid understanding of healthcare quality and safety measures, regulations, and reporting requirements, such as those established by regulatory agencies and accreditation bodies is preferred. Publication record in peer-reviewed journals and experience presenting at conferences or industry events is desirable.
Effective written and oral communication skills, especially in communicating business and technical information. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and recommendations. Ability to provide data tables and graphics that significantly enhance the interpretation of analysis results.
Strong interpersonal skills, including the ability to professionally interact with external stakeholders and project partners, especially in communicating technical or statistical information and specifications. Proven ability to work collaboratively in interdisciplinary teams and manage multiple projects with competing priorities. Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively present statistical findings to both technical and non-technical audiences. Flexibility to accommodate shifting priorities and accommodate ad hoc analyses.
Highly independent, requiring minimal supervision. Attention to detail and a commitment to maintaining the highest standards of data accuracy and integrity. Demonstrates a results-orientation, determination, ownership of responsibility, reliability, and accountability. Experience mentoring and training junior staff including data scientists and analysts.

This job description is intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by an employee assigned to this position. The description is not an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, knowledge, skills, and abilities, and working conditions associated with this position. All requirements are subject to possible modification and reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.

At HCSC, we consider our employees the cornerstone of our business and the foundation to our success. We enable employees to craft their career with curated development plans that set their learning path to a rewarding and fulfilling career.

Job Summary

We’re looking for a Lead Data Science Product Manager in our Data Science & AI Solutions organization. We have many different domains (or thematic units) within this organization, with topics that include Claims, Member Engagement, Utilization Management, Quality, Risk Stratification, Foundational, and AI Innovation Lab. The work of each domain is generally led by 1 (or sometimes 2) Product Managers, who engage senior and executive leadership in the domain area to understand their most significant business challenges, design new data science products and solutions to automate or enable better decision making to address these challenges, build long-term product roadmaps, scale and deliver on those products by working within cross-functional data science, IT, and business teams, and provide overall product leadership for one or more of our machine learning and AI initiatives. Successful candidates will also have indirect leadership over data scientists and engineers assigned to these initiatives. This is an exciting opportunity to lead the adoption of AI to transform one of HCSC’s core capabilities and drive tremendous impact for our customers and members.

At the largest customer-owned and not-for-profit health insurer and fourth largest health insurer overall in the United States, you will have the opportunity to work with massive datasets to drive revenue growth, improve our operational and member-facing processes, and affect how healthcare is delivered to our 17 million members.

An ideal candidate is someone who has a demonstrated track record of leading or delivering analytical projects and products with measurable value, can see the big picture and effectively communicate with executives, has an ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences, and has a laser-focused customer and user-centric mindset.
Note that while this position requires an understanding of data science, machine learning, and AI and its applications, it is not a technical role. We are looking for a business person who has a strong technical background that can lead and indirectly influence both IT and business teams to scale and deploy models in a complex organizational environment.

Job Purpose:
Serves as the business interface of the team to deliver predictive / prescriptive analytics, as well as descriptive reports / dashboards, as needed; accountable for the operationalization of data science solutions.

Required Job Qualifications:

Bachelor degree and 5 years of work experience in a mathematical, statistical, computer science, engineering, physics, economics or related quantitative field OR Actuarial credential or Master degree and 4 years of work experience in an advanced mathematical, statistical , engineering, physics or related quantitative field OR Ph.D. and 2 years of work experience in a mathematical, statistical, computer science, engineering, physics, economics or related quantitative field OR 8 years of work experience in an advanced mathematical, statistical , engineering, physics or related quantitative field
Must demonstrate proficiency in at least four of the following six areas: 1) data analysis and relational-style query languages; 2) machine learning and/or statistical modeling; 3) data visualization; 4) a high-level programming language; 5) distributed computing; 6) understanding of healthcare.
Strong learning and growth mindset
Customer-focused
Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
A track record of independently delivering or leading the delivery of multiple complex analytics or data science projects with measurable value

Preferred Job Qualifications:

Previous product management experience
Previous experience working with insurance claims systems or applications
Experience with Iterative / Agile / Scrum development

Job Summary

Job Title: Senior Principal Product Owner - Machine Learning Operations
Job Description:
Discover. A brighter future.

With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day & We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.

Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.

Job Description:

Discover’s Decisioning Platform product family entails various products working in harmony to facilitate the development, deployment, and monitoring of machine learning models. This role specifically focuses on the Machine Learning Operations (ML Ops) product within the Decisioning Platform product family. The mission of the ML Ops product is to reduce the time to market for model deployment in an automated, compliant, and secure fashion. This role will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and presenting the vision and roadmap for the Decisioning ML Ops product used by model delivery teams across multiple lines of business at Discover. This role will create product vision based on a thorough understanding of direct and indirect stakeholders needs working with business initiative owners and technology teams. Guides requirements, manages priorities, and is accountable for delivery. Empowered to make fast decisions about the initiatives, with input from leadership and other key stakeholders. Ensures the technology teams are synthesizing business objectives and agile development principles to operate and expand the existing Feature Orchestration platform. Experience with machine learning platforms as well as a fundamental understanding of the machine learning lifecycle is a plus.

Responsibilities

Ensures an outcome for a product is delivered that meets the requests from stakeholders and customers. This requires a fundamental understanding of the business and its constraints (financial, marketing, compliance, legal, service, the customer environment, the technical capabilities, the user experience, etc.) in order to provide a solution that satisfies all stakeholders and customers.
Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.
Interacts and collaborates with stakeholders on key product considerations and aligns with product vision, features and roadmap. Leverages customer insights, feedback, financials, compliance and risk data to define product features and roadmap in partnership with other SMEs.

Job Title: Data Scientist

Company: GPFS is the fund administrator of choice for a wide range of clients in the US, UK, and EU. Every day, with every decision and every client interaction, our values serve as guideposts, to improve the quality of our work, and strengthen our employee and client relationships.

As a business that is all about people; culture isn't an initiative, it's an innate value that's critical to every decision we make. At GPFS, people come first.

At GPFS, diversity is a source of strength, both from our people and ideas. GPFS is a collaborative team-oriented organization where we support each other both personally and professionally. Our culture is defined by our behavior, our curiosity and our support of innovative ideas and perspectives.

Our inclusive culture supports and encourages our team members to try new things, share ideas openly and always ask the question why. It brings us together and makes the team stronger by inspiring all to connect, belong and thrive.





Location: Latham, NY





Job Type: Full-time

This position is part of a growing team at GPFS which centers around Data Services for Private Market clients. In this role you will be analyzing and modeling large data sets (i.e., accounting, financial, regulatory) through various reporting tools to support strategic needs for internal and external organizational stakeholders.





Essential Duties:

Collaborate with data analysts, management, and other stakeholders to support data-driven decisions throughout the organization.

Apply data mining techniques to identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets.
Maintain workflows related to data processing tasks.
Apply data governance standards and best practices across teams and applications.
Sustain ongoing knowledge and trends in data analytics and science.
Present complex concepts in a clear and succinct way.

3-5 years of Data Analytics experience

Excel / VBA
SQL / SSRS

Business Intelligence / visualization tools
AI / NLP

Competencies

Embraces Flexibility: Deals effectively with adapting to new formats or tools and navigates through unstructured problems with fluid outcomes.
Results Driven – focuses on achieving high-quality outcomes by prioritizing clients and iterating through projects to achieve success.
Collaborative – works with diverse teams both within and outside the organization, fostering a spirit of teamwork and mutual respect.

Solutions for Today’s Challenges. Vision for Tomorrow’s Opportunities. Join the Premier Global Boutique: William Blair.

At William Blair, serving our clients starts with the capabilities and collaboration of our team—making our employees our most important asset. The Information Technology team has the mission of becoming a true business partner and we are searching for a Data Scientist to help execute on this mission. The Data Scientist will use data analysis to understand customer profiles, produce reports to track our business, build models to provide insight into our business and customer base, identify opportunities, and impact the strategy of business to drive growth and achieve productivity gains. Communication and presentation skills

Experience communicating with and influencing technical and non-technical audiences (engineers, data scientists, program managers, bankers, financial advisors)

Job Title: Data Scientist: Natural Language Processing and GenAI
Job Description:
Gamma Technologies, LLC (GT) is looking for a Data Scientist: Natural Language Processing & GenAI Expert with a solid work ethic, excellent judgment, and a desire to build a long-term career with us. This position is based in our corporate office in Westmont, Illinois.

Position Summary

We are looking for a creative, talented, and highly motivated Data Scientist to join our AI/ML development team. As a Natural Language Processing and Generative AI Expert, you will contribute to the development of modern user experiences for our flagship product GT-SUITE, which is the world’s leading engineering simulation software focused mainly on the automotive industry. You will be involved in the design and implementation of applications and tools based on NLP and GenAI that will revolutionize the way that our software interacts with the users while maintaining a responsible approach to the use of these technologies.

Job Responsibilities

Analyze the specifications for Gen AI-enabled applications such as chatbots.
Present and discuss available architectures for creating such tools.
Identify sources of training data.
Design robust, accurate, and secure solutions.
Train, validate, and test the appropriate models.
Develop interfaces for integration of the models into our software.
Share your knowledge through mentoring, code reviews, and taking part in design discussions.
Collaborate with application engineers on new requirements and application design.
Study new technologies to remain technically current.

Education, Experience, and Skills

Any combination of education and experience that would likely provide the required knowledge and abilities is qualifying. A typical way to obtain the knowledge and abilities would be:

S. degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field is required.
Desired GPA of 3.2 out of 4.0.
1+ year of professional experience in Natural Language Processing and/or GenAI projects.
3+ years of professional experience in related data science fields such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, and text mining.
Expert knowledge in NLP/LLM algorithms and models.
Strong understanding of statistical methods and machine learning framework
Programming experience with Python, Java, or C++.
NLP certification is a plus.
Strong communication, problem-solving, and analytical skills.
Ability to work independently, as well as work collaboratively with colleagues.

Salary and Benefits

GT offers competitive pay, vacation, sick and personal days, and a work environment that allows you to grow and prosper.
We offer best-in-class health benefits for you and your dependents.
We offer a 401k and Roth 401k retirement plans.
We provide an onsite fitness center.
The primary work location will be our Westmont, IL office. We’ve adopted a hybrid work policy asking employees to report to the office 3 days per work week.
As an organization, we value collaborating and learning from our peers in person, while providing the necessary flexibility for our employees to have a meaningful work-life balance.

Other Requirements and Notes:

All U.S.-based GT employees are required to be fully vaccinated, subject to legally required accommodations.
All candidates must be eligible to work in the US for any employer; no third parties, please.
Universal acceptance for everyone, everywhere is at the heart of our company. We promote diversity of thought, culture, and background, which connects the entire Gamma Technologies community. As such, Gamma Technologies is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, military or veteran status, citizenship, or other characteristics protected by state or federal law or local ordinance.

About Gamma Technologies, LLC

GT, a leading multi-physics CAE simulation software provider, develops a suite of integrated solutions that guides and accelerates the engineering transformation of today’s products in the transportation, power generation, and industrial equipment industries.

At GT, we are committed to using technology to make a global impact by helping the industry deliver products for a cleaner, sustainable environment! We pride ourselves on our company culture which encourages collaboration between all levels at the company, from entry-level to upper management. Within a team, daily interactions and outside social events allow us to form bonds that result in higher productivity and job satisfaction.

Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic medicines. Our 115,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.

The Co-op assignment will be with the Biologics Discovery team within Abbott Diagnostics Research and Development. The R&D team discovers and designs biologics for use in diagnostic assays. The team consists of scientists with subject matter expertise in molecular biology, cell culture, microbiology, protein engineering and DNA sequencing. In addition to contributing to ongoing biologics discovery projects, the team is expanding their bioinformatics and bioprospecting capabilities.

The Co-op assignment will assist in developing a process to mine publicly available databases for protein sequence information and augment an existing pipeline for clustering those sequences. In addition, the co-op will build a GUI for deployment of the pipeline to the wider team. The co-op will use and build upon skill sets in bioinformatics and Artificial Intelligence. A background in Python is required and experience designing and developing web applications using Microsoft ASP.NET (Web Forms/MVC/Web API) is preferred.

Co-ops work 6-month, full-time assignment
This posting is for candidates able to start in January 2024
Candidates must be currently enrolled at an accredited graduate program
GPA of 3.0 or greater
Strong analytical, problem solving and communication skills
Ability to learn quickly and work independently with minimal direct supervision
Candidate must be available to work full-time (40 hours/week) during the 6 month Co-op session
Students must be able to work in the US without requiring sponsorship

Job Title: Senior Data Scientist, Clinical Analytics (On-Site, Illinois Based)
Job Description:
Purpose:
A team of data scientists with a unique blend of Business, Scientific, and Machine Learning expertise who seek to:

Unleash the full potential of AbbVie’s data assets by bringing technology and/or data and insights to the forefront of decision making via fit-for-purpose data analytics solutions

Broaden the scope and impact of Analytics and Data Science by constantly exploring new opportunities to transform clinical development and R&D

Collaborate with stakeholders to outline the problem, explore solutions, refine opportunities and deliver a product with a continuous innovation mindset

Responsibilities:

Connects with cross-functional teams to design work product and as an analytics consultant. Anticipates and identifies issues that could affect timelines or quality and develops options and solutions

Leads and helps establish the design principles and standards to ensure analytical work product is consistent across projects where appropriate and that user experience is optimized

In addition to standard statistical methods, develops prototypes, test methods and algorithms. Leverages emerging statistical methodologies, ML and AI to drive innovative analytical solutions to create insights

Enables data-driven insights to support of clinical development continuum, including precision medicine

Ensures adherence to federal regulations and applicable local regulations, Good Clinical Practices (GCPs), ICH Guidelines, AbbVie Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), and to functional quality standards. Stays abreast of new and/or evolving local regulations, guidelines and policies related to clinical development

Identify business needs and support the creation of standard KPIs, reports, and statistical analyses;

Responsible for coaching and mentoring junior team members.

Work side by side with cross-functional teams as an analytics consultant to strategize on how analytics can help evaluate the progress of clinical trials, as well as facilitate discussions around emerging risks; Applies machine learning techniques to validate assumptions and predict future behavior


Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree statistics, analytics, bioinformatics, data science or equivalent field. Master’s degree preferred

Must have 3-5 years of analytics-related experience in clinical research including demonstrated high-level analytics and leadership competencies.

Advanced career level proficiency in R, Python or other statistical packages. Intermediate-level knowledge of statistical and data mining techniques

Expert proficiency with visualization tools like Spotfire, Tableau or equivalent

Proven expertise with Machine Learning and other advanced analytics techniques

Demonstrated effective communication skills. Demonstrated ability to communicate analytical and technical concepts in layman’s terms

Demonstrated problem-solving and analytical skills

Demonstrated history of successful execution in a fast-paced environment and in managing multiple priorities effectively

Experience working in Cloud Computing environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, etc) is preferred




AbbVie is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives, serving our community, and embracing diversity and inclusion. It is AbbVie’s policy to employ qualified persons of the greatest ability without discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected group status.

Overview:
Come join the largest beer distributor in the United States and be a part of our Performance Promise where we live out our company’s purpose of connecting customers, consumers and brands every day, everywhere we operate.

At Reyes Beverage Group, we’re proud to be the largest beer distributor in the United States — and distribute a growing number of spirits brands, too. We deliver over 325 million cases annually to over 115,000 retail accounts across the nation. We are committed to being the distributor of choice by providing unparalleled service and continually striving to grow our customers’ profitability.

Are you ready to start or propel your beer career with the largest and fastest growing distributor? We represent the best brands in the country including Modelo, Miller Lite, Coors Light, Corona, White Claw, Heineken, Truly, Pacifico, Yuengling, Lagunitas, Blue Moon, and more! We offer competitive pay and benefits, best-in-class training, and advancement opportunities that will turn this job into a career. Tap into your talent by applying today!
Responsibilities:
Pay Transparency Statement:
The compensation philosophy reflects the Company’s reasonable expectation at the time of posting. We consider a number of factors when making individual compensation decisions including, but not limited to, skill sets, experience and training, and other business needs. This role may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary incentive program, subject to the rule governing the program.

Position Summary:

The Data Scientist has a solid understanding of advanced analytics and will be responsible for refining existing statistical/machine learning models and developing new ones to support business. The Data Scientist will partner with direct team members as well as cross-functional partners and decision makers. This person’s primary tasks will be to develop, refine, deploy, and productionize impactful data science projects for business users.


Position Responsibilities may include, but not limited to:




Identify best or most applicable analytical techniques for a given business problem.
Develop and deploy statistical and machine learning models to address business problems using Python and others.
Maintain and refine existing models and related processes, plus various data-driven non-model processes.
Utilize statistical or time-series models to make predictions on future outcomes in multiple scenarios.
Implement models and create processes to monitor their performance, including input data integrity.
Employ data visualization tools and codes where appropriate via Power BI and others.
Partner with IT / BI / Data teams to ensure data used for modeling accurately reflects business reality.
Effectively communicate model approaches, outputs, and findings to technical and non-technical audiences.
Document projects including business objectives, data gathering/processing, approaches and algorithms, and detailed set of results and analytical metrics.
Ensure modeling processes always conform to IT security standards.
Other projects or duties as assigned.
Qualifications:

Required Skills and Experience:

Bachelor’s Degree in Analytics, Data Science, Operations Research, Statistics, or other related quantitative discipline.
2+ years’ experience in data science, advanced analytics, or quantitative/computational functions.
Deployed regression, time-series, and machine learning models in Python or other languages, for a variety of business problems.
Working knowledge in analytical techniques such as multivariate regression, time series, classification methods, Bayesian methods, or neural networks.
Experiences in databases and SQL and in big data/cloud platforms such Azure, Databricks, Snowflake, and Spark.
Experiences in data visualization tools such as Power BI for reporting model outputs, data trends, business issues, or exceptions.
This position must pass a post-offer background and drug test.

Preferred Skills and Experience:

3+ years’ experience in data science or similar functions.
Experience in Blue Yonder.
Experience in Git for version control and in lifecycle management tools such as MLflow.
Productionized large-scale ML models via CI/CD pipelines and distributed computing.
Experience in consumer-packaged goods or distribution/wholesale.
Physical Demands and Work Environment:
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Due to the nature of our business in regard to such things as delivery schedules, order inputs, selection, and Department of Transportation Hours of Service, overtime, attendance and punctuality are essential job functions. Should an individual in this classification not be able to adhere to this requirement due to a disability, they should contact their Human Resources department to see what, if any, reasonable accommodation may be made.

Job Title: Product Engineering Lead, Artificial Intelligence - PDT DD&T Innovation
Job Description:
By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge.

Job Description

ABOUT PLASMA-DERIVED THERAPIES

As a trusted global leader and industry partner who is reimagining plasma and exploring its untapped potential, Takeda’s Plasma-Derived Therapies Business Unit is dedicated to transforming the lives of patients worldwide who rely on these lifesaving and life-sustaining therapies.

With an 80-year legacy of developing treatments for rare and complex chronic diseases, we thrive on innovation, offering a broad, differentiated portfolio of more than 20 plasma medicines with integrated care solutions to patients in more than 80 countries.

Powered by 17,000+ Takeda employees primarily focused on plasma, our > 200 high-quality BioLife donation centers, a dedicated R&D team, and eight world-class plasma manufacturing facilities, we are unleashing data, digital and technology to transform our end-to-end operations and set new industry standards.

This enables us to meet innovatively and sustainably the growing and changing needs of patients, our people, and our planet, today and in the future.

THE OPPORTUNITY

The position of Product Engineering Lead, Artificial Intelligence is a vital role within Takeda’s Plasma-Derived Therapies Function that will be a key player in driving ideation and value realization with business stakeholders by introducing, educating, influencing, and driving modernization within the Takeda portfolio. This position requires strength in verbal and non-verbal communication across diverse time zones and regions, with an emphasis on relationship building and ability to educate, persuade, and build collaborative trust with stakeholders. The ability to communicate technical knowledge and AI concepts is key, bringing ideas and outside the box thinking into how AI/ML/NLP/GenAI and process automation can enhance productivity and reduce manual work processes. This role is also responsible for bringing latest findings in the fields mentioned above in a way that clearly communicates the benefits and potential within a highly regulated area of the healthcare pharmaceutical industry.

Here you will help Takeda realize our ambition to transform the lives of patients through innovation and sustainability from plasma donation to delivery of medicines.

This is turn empowers Takeda’s unwavering commitment to patients.

YOUR TASKS IN DETAIL

Build deep relationships across business units and groups, both technical and non-technical.
Educate and inform across all of Takeda on latest industry trends, avoiding pitfalls from others, bringing innovative thought and championing process automation.
Identify opportunities for adjacent and disruptive innovation to support business and technology strategies.
Ownership and continual update of curriculum and education materials related to AI/ML/NLP/GenAI/process automation that can be shared with various teams.
Manage delivery of prototypes and PoCs, timeline, budget, necessary resources, etc.
Recognize stakeholder needs through primary/secondary research such as focus groups, interviews, observations, presentations, and data.
Develop a deep contextual understanding of our customers, our users, and their needs.
Determine how particular capability enhances moments of customer journey.
Demonstrates ability to provide level of transparency and visibility with cross-functional partners including leadership and stakeholders.
Be comfortable generating and evaluating data to guide decisions.
Steer implementation partners and making decisions based on information collected to accelerate the delivery of the product.
Ensure product follows all company and departmental policies, procedures, and standards.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATION, EXPERIENCE & SKILLS

Minimum 5 years of technology experience with bachelor’s degree or 7 years technology experience without bachelor’s degree.
Minimum 2 years’ experience in a Product Owner/Manager role
Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, Outlook).
Preferred experience with Agile tools (e.g., Jira, Confluence, Miro, etc.)
Experience with planning and managing all phases of system development (e.g., requirements gathering, design, configuration, development, COTS selection, testing, conversion, and application support)
Ability to write and speak in the English language
Ability to fly to meetings regionally and globally
Access to transportation to attend meetings
Remote work setup (needs to be based in the US)

Desirable:

Pharmaceutical, healthcare, or consumer-facing industry experience
Agile, Product Owner/Manager or Project Manager certifications

WHAT TAKEDA CAN OFFER YOU

For the fifth consecutive year, Takeda has been certified by the Top Employers Institute as a

Global Top Employer. No investment we make pays greater dividends than taking good care of our people.

We offer you:

A meaningful career, grounded in our values
Continuous professional growth and global careers
A diverse and inclusive network of colleagues
Comprehensive Healthcare: Medical, Dental, and Vision
Financial Planning & Stability: 401(k) with company match and Annual Retirement Contribution Plan
Health & Wellness programs including onsite flu shots and health screenings
Generous time off for vacation and the option to purchase additional vacation days
Community Outreach Programs and company match of charitable contributions

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At our heart are committed colleagues. We offer interested people numerous opportunities and strongly believe in, and promote, diversity, equity, and inclusion. As a company we offer roles based on merit, welcoming candidates of any gender, age, religious belief, race or ethnic origin or disability.


In accordance with the CO Equal Pay Act, Colorado applicants are not permitted to apply.

NEXT STEPS

Ready to apply? If you are interested in this opportunity, we look forward to receiving your application via our online tool! (Please attach your CV in English)

Not yet? For further questions, please contact Claire Alonzo-Regis (Talent Acquisition Partner) via email: claire.alonzo@takeda.com

Join our dynamic, progressive team of IT professionals in an environment where you can learn, grow, and create innovative technology solutions to help our business flourish. At the heart of Kellanova is technology — a key enabler of how we market, sell, and manufacture our well-known and beloved brands to consumers around the globe.

We have an opening for you as a Data Scientist. This critical role will collaborate with the business to answer questions and promote efficiencies by using data and advanced analytic techniques. Location preference is in Chicago, IL or Battle Creek, MI but the position can also be remote.

A Taste of What You’ll Be Doing

Direct Business Partnering - In this role, you will be working with multiple levels of the business and leadership to better enable analytics and data across the organization. By leveraging your experience, leadership skills, positive attitude as well as you’re understanding for cross-functional relationships, you will help deliver practical analytical and data solutions within in a global environment. Leading the design, development, and deployment of data-driven predictive models to solve business problems using the most appropriate techniques in data mining, machine learning, and statistical modeling.
Data Analysis - Diving into large, noisy, and complex real-world data to produce innovative analysis of historical patterns in customer behaviors and product performance. Working closely with data warehouse architects and software developers to generate seamless business intelligence solutions for business partners.
Decision Support – Piloting emerging data and analytics technologies to help Kellanova understand how to exploit new methodologies, technologies, and tools. Driving toward deep visibility of the business, end-to-end through analytics and fact-based data disciplines. Advocating for and train the organization during deployment of analytic solutions.

Your Recipe for Success

Bachelor's in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or related field with extensive relevant work experience
Strong experience with analytical tools and technology (e.g. R/Python, RStudio, R Shiny, AWS Data & Analytics services)
Experience with SQL, Hive, Presto, Hadoop, or other data querying languages.
Experience designing and building statistical forecasting and machine learning models.
Experience with communicating findings and actionable recommendations/insights to stake holders using data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc.)
Exceptional customer service and collaboration skills.
Ability to manage multiple and sometimes conflicting priorities.

What’s Next

Who We Are

Core Spaces is a vertically integrated company focused on acquiring, developing, and managing residential properties that create a better life for everyone under our roof. What We Do

Position Overview

Core Spaces seeks a talented and experienced Data Scientist to join our dynamic and growing engineering team. You will join a team mix of software engineers, data engineers, and Looker developers who have been working for 18+ months to build a data pipeline from our critical systems to gain visibility into key business KPIs. The team is now ready for a seasoned Data Scientist to help validate our existing work and shape our approach to new data from other disparate systems moving forward. Our team aims to enable Core Spaces to move from gaining insight to gaining foresight into our business, helping us make more data-informed decisions and identify opportunities when they arise. This role presents an exciting opportunity to leverage your data skills to shape the future of Core Spaces and, in turn, the real estate industry.



What You Will Do
Utilize data analysis and statistical techniques to extract valuable insights from real estate data, helping improve company operations, identify opportunities, and gain visibility into our performance.
Collaborate across the Technology team and the company to build relationships and identify opportunities across Core Spaces and our data to provide valuable insight and foresight into our business and market.
Develop creative models for opportunities in our industry that remain unidentified.
Communicate and present the results of your models to the company to explain the results of your experiments and the potential of your work.
Productize your models to enable the company to take advantage of the model so that we make more informed decisions leveraging all the data at our disposal.
Work closely with the existing team to help qualify the existing models and products while better understanding our most critical company data.
Continuously monitor and evaluate the outcomes and impact of your work, ensuring they meet and exceed business objectives while actively adapting strategies for ongoing improvement.
Ideally, you'll have
Bachelor's or Master's in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or related field or appropriate job experience.
At least of 5 years of applicable experience as a Data Scientist
Curiosity and initiative to understand the mechanics of our business and develop solutions.
Proficiency in either Python or Perl for data manipulation, scripting, and automating data processes.
Proficiency in machine learning techniques and algorithms, with a proven track record of applying them to solve real-world data problems.
Proficiency in working with relational databases and SQL (e.g., Postgres), enabling efficient data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
Experience building models that translate into products delivered via business intelligence tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, etc.).
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team and independently.


You'll crush it if you have experience with
Experience with Looker and LookML to develop, maintain, and optimize data models and dashboards for reporting and analysis.
Experience being a leader among data engineering teams.
Experience with Google Cloud Platform (we currently use BigQuery and Google Cloud Storage)
Familiarity with dbt (Data Build Tool) for data transformation and modeling.
This role can be onsite in Chicago or Austin, hybrid or remote. $120k-170k base + bonus

As a Data Scientist at Diverge Health you will work closely with our principal engineers to set up the foundations of our data analytics and reporting platform. Background in value-based care organizations.

Experience with the Diverge data stack, including Python, dbt, and Snowflake.

Job Summary

Our Analytics & AI Solutions Team is hiring for a Senior Data Scientist within our claims domain. This position is responsible for providing advanced mathematical and statistical methods to solve business problems, with minimal direction from leadership. Senior data scientists collect, integrate and analyze data from sources related to health status and outcomes for our members, characteristics of health care providers, internal business processes, and other domains. Senior data scientists perform complex statistical analysis on experimental or business data to validate and quantify trends or patterns identified by business analysts. Senior data scientists select and adapt machine learning and probabilistic modeling methods to construct predictive algorithms to support data analysis or product functions. They verify model and algorithm effectiveness based on real-world results. Senior data scientists design experiments and methodologies to generate and collect data for business use. Senior data scientists create visualizations, interactive analytical applications and interpretive artifacts to support business application of data science findings. Senior data scientists represent the perspective of the data science team on cross-functional teams and contribute to consequential decisions.

Required Job Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree and 3 years of work experience in a mathematical, statistical, computer science, engineering, physics, economics or related quantitative field; OR Actuarial credential; OR Master’s degree and 2 years of work experience in a mathematical, statistical, computer science, engineering, physics, economics or related quantitative field; OR Ph.D. in a mathematical, statistical, computer science, engineering, physics, economics or related quantitative field; OR 7 years experience in a mathematical, statistical, computer science, engineering, physics, economics or related quantitative field.
Strong learning and growth mindset
Customer focus
Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.
Proficiency in at least four of the following six areas: 1) data analysis and relational-style query languages; 2) machine learning and/or statistical modeling; 3) data visualization; 4) a high-level programming language; 5) distributed computing; 6) understanding of healthcare.

Preferred Job Qualifications:

Master's or Ph.D. in a quantitative field, or bachelor's degree with significant healthcare experience.

This is a hybrid position and must be based out of our Chicago, IL or Richardson, TX office.

Job Title: Data Scientist with NLP & Python Exp
Job Description:
Job Title: Data Scientist with NLP & Python Exp
Location: Chicago, IL
Duration: Full Time

Top Requirements:

NLP
Python
3+ years as a Data Scientist

Required Skills:

5+ years of proven experience in NLP, data annotation and performance evaluation, preferably in an industry setting
Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python and experience with relevant libraries (NLTK, spaCy, scikit-learn, etc.)
Familiarity with developing and maintaining data pipelines, version control systems and continuous integration tools
Solid understanding of various NLP tasks, including sentiment analysis, entity recognition, text classification, etc
Experience with statistical analysis and visualization tools (e.g., pandas, matplotlib, seaborn) to present performance metrics
Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously
Effective communication skills to convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Strong collaboration skills and ability to work with cross-functional teams
Knowledge of machine learning concepts and techniques is a plus
Experience with dashboarding tools like Power BI and Tableau
Attention to detail ensuring accuracy in data and recognizing anomalies or errors in data
Previous experience with database and data pipeline tools like PostgreSQL, Apache Spark

Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain robust code pipelines for textual data annotation, encompassing various levels such as lexicon-based and phrase-based annotation.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including NLP researchers and software engineers, to integrate data annotation pipelines into the overall data processing framework.
Design and implement data labeling rules based on lexicon groups using weak-supervision techniques, ensuring high- quality and consistent annotation outputs.
Review and curate annotated data to maintain accuracy and relevance, addressing potential ambiguities and inconsistencies.
Compute, analyze and present performance statistics, including precision, recall, F1 score, and other relevant metrics, to evaluate the effectiveness of the annotated pipelines.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their needs and goals and translate technical findings to actionable insights that drive informed decision-making.
Work closely with machine learning engineers to incorporate labeled data into model training and fine-tuning processes.
Stay up to date with the latest advancements in NLP, data annotation techniques, and performance evaluation methodologies, and apply this knowledge to enhance annotation process.
Document and communicate annotation pipelines, methodologies, and findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audience.
Performing analysis to assess the quality and meaning of data.
Build ETL pipelines and automate data ingestion, transformation and storage.

Job Type: Full-time

Work Location: In person

Career Area:
Business Technologies, Digital and Data
Job Description:

Your Work Shapes the World at Caterpillar Inc.

When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do – but also about each other. We are the makers, problem solvers, and future world builders who are creating stronger, more sustainable communities. We don't just talk about progress and innovation here – we make it happen, with our customers, where we work and live. Together, we are building a better world, so we can all enjoy living in it.

Our Product Support and Logistics Division (PSLD) is one of the most innovative divisions within Caterpillar. In PSLD, as within all of Caterpillar, our priority is our customers and helping them build a better world. We touch nearly every element of the services value stream from procurement to design and manufacturing to distribution. PSLD is responsible for Aftermarket Parts Distribution of Cat Parts, Integrated Logistics, segment Procurement and the design and manufacture of Wear Components (Undercarriage and GET) and Maintenance Components (Seals, Tubes & Hardware, Hose & Couplings, Fluids and Filters).

We’re committed to our customers, who build a better world with our products, services, and solutions. We understand and show the value of why they should always choose us. We’re exploring new ideas and opportunities – innovating to discover the breakthroughs necessary for tomorrow’s growth.

Through it all, we are one team – creating and delivering world-class components and solutions superior to the competition. Learn more about the Caterpillar Experience .

What You Will Do:



Caterpillar uses quantitative techniques to solve problems. Typical problems include maximizing OPACC through improvements in Inventory Costs, Material Costs, NPI costs, etc.; determining the principal drivers of heath care costs; recommending the optimal supplier for a part; identifying sales, rental, and service opportunities for Caterpillar dealers; and developing simulation/optimization capabilities to model a new facility or product feature. In addition, would also provide analytic assistance to high-profile enterprise-wide projects such as Engineered Value Chain. Provides thought leadership and helps set strategic direction through the project management and solution development.

The primary responsibility of a Senior Data Scientist is to use their leadership and planning/organizing abilities and experience leading analytics project teams to form and lead teams of Data Scientists, Data Analysts, and Subject Matter Experts (SME). As the Senior Data Scientist, you will be responsible for managing the project charter, team and stakeholder communications, and the overall project plan and budget. The Senior Data Scientist is assigned some of the highest value and most complex projects in the portfolio.

Use knowledge of analytical methods and business acumen to guide cross-functional teams in the chartering and execution of analytics projects.
Manage two (2) to three (3) projects concurrently.
Demonstrate thorough knowledge of Caterpillar, Inc.; its products and services; its internal systems, processes, and procedures; and is relevant external influences (competitors, laws and regulations, market conditions, etc.) to meet or exceed customer expectations.
Serve as the principal communicator with clients and internal stakeholders regarding project status.
Lead and manage some of the largest and most complex projects in the portfolio.
Other duties as assigned by Caterpillar management from time-to-time.

Challenges with this position are working with people; enhancing the team’s creativity; facilitating the team’s cooperation; clearly communicating the requirements and tasks, while gaining input from the team on refinement of same; translating both verbal and non-verbal information from the customer, management, and team members. The Senior Data Scientist acts a spokesperson for the team in meetings with multiple levels of management and with the customer. As a Senior Data Scientist, they must develop strong internal networks to enable them to obtain resources and cooperation needed and remove roadblocks so that they can ensure the success of their project team.

The Senior Data Scientist bears primary responsibility for meeting customer expectations for the projects they are leading.

The Senior Data Scientist demonstrates thorough knowledge of analytical approaches/techniques and the ability to handle the most complex project issues, the individual demonstrates very good communication skills, exceptional planning and organization capabilities, and is able to explain conclusions to customers who have limited knowledge and experience with quantitative analytical methods. As a senior role leading analytic project teams, he or she is expected to have previous experience leading teams and in project management, and should exhibit above average initiative, the ability to delegate tasks, and demonstrated leadership and interpersonal skills. He or she should also have a comprehensive knowledge of Caterpillar, Inc.; its products and services; its internal systems, processes, and procedures; and a general understanding of Caterpillar’s external customers, competitors, and market influencers.

What You Have (Basic Qualifications):

Master’s or PhD in Engineering, Mathematics, or Data Science.
5-7 years of experience working on analytics projects including querying databases using SQL, high-level programming, and modeling.
3 (plus) years using Python (including data science libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, and Scikit-learn) or equivalent prominent data analysis environment (R, SAS, etc.).
2-3 years of experience leading analytics projects leveraging data from various business domains and providing forecasts and insights to run the business profitably.
Experience with different types of databases such as Snowflake, SQL server, DB2, and Oracle.
Practical knowledge of Cloud computing and software development from cloud environments.
Ability to communicate effectively with team members and others in the work group, as well as with customers.
The ability to travel both domestically up to 5% of the time.

What You Have (Preferred Qualifications):

Thorough knowledge of Caterpillar, Inc.; its products and services, its internal systems, processes, and procedures; and its relevant external influences (competitors, laws and regulations, market conditions, etc.).
Breadth and depth of knowledge in the application of statistical and machine learning in the analytics field.
Competency in coaching and mentoring junior Data Scientists in the creation, validation, and application of statistical models as well as implementing digital solutions.
Strong initiative to research and apply new methods and digital technologies to exceed customer expectations.


Additional Information:

Location: Morton, IL (USA), Champaign, IL (USA), Chicago, IL (USA), or Dallas, TX (USA)
This position does offer relocation assistance.
Our team embraces flexibility through a hybrid work model. In addition to working onsite at one of our facilities in Morton, IL, Champaign, IL, Chicago, IL, or Dallas, TX, our hybrid work model allows employees the flexibility to work from home based on business need.

#LI

#BI

Relocation is available for this position.Visa sponsorship available for eligible applicants.
