The Mesulam Cognitive Neurology and Alzheimer’s Disease Center (Mesulam CNADC) is a multi-departmental component of the Feinberg School of Medicine. We specialize in the clinical care and scientific study of neurological diseases that interfere with cognition and behavior. Areas of emphasis include age-related memory impairments and dementias. Our three interacting missions are to investigate the causes and clinical characteristics of neurodegenerative diseases, to ensure that our patients are the beneficiaries of the latest advances, and to explore the neural foundations of behavior and cognition in health and disease.

This position is within the Neuroimaging and Biomarker Core which is a part of the NIA-funded Alzheimer’s Disease Research Center, which focuses on aging and dementia research including Alzheimer’s. This position will work in a collaborative environment to assist with the coordination, processing and analysis of MR and PET neuroimaging data.

Title: data Scientist

Location: Morton, IL

Duration: 12+ Months

Open for C2C as well

Job Description:
The Machine Data Insights team within Machine Analytics is seeking a talented and motivated Data Scientist to develop analyses that support product development analytics, aftermarket analytics, demand forecasting analytics, and other strategic analytics areas of focus. Our team’s mission is to understand our customers where their work gets done. Our analyses reveal machine usage insights that help our customers work safer and more productively and help our enterprise understand the market trends that shape our future business. This role will require a skillset in advanced statistical modeling and machine learning techniques as well as domain knowledge of industrial equipment.

Job Duties:
The Data Scientist I will participate on cross-functional project teams in order to solve a problem presented by a Client Business Unit or Service Organization, a Client Dealer, or a Client Customer.

The key role of this second level data scientist position is to move from learning and assisting others to learning to contribute independently. The Data Scientist I is expected to become familiar with the company’s processes, products, and organization. Work is typically directed by a project or team lead who might review both methods and results. Challenges include meeting expectations in delivering results, learning to consider alternative courses of actions, making timely decisions, developing communication skills, working with people, and pushing the technical bounds of experimentation while meeting customer commitments.

Individuals in this position might expect to have several assignments allowing them to gain experience on multiple projects. They will be expected to apply theory and concept in contributing to the solution in the assigned area.

The job function may include data collection and analysis; development, validation, application, and refinement of statistical models; application of related digital technologies in processing both the inputs and outputs from the models.

The Data Scientist I demonstrates an expanded breadth of knowledge and the ability to handle basic issues independently. They also demonstrate very good communication skills; planning and organization, teamwork, and decision making skills; a strong concern for customers; a strong focus on continual learning in the Analytics field; and has basic knowledge of Client Inc., and its products and services.

Basic Qualifications:

Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree, preferably in engineering, computer science, statistics, economics, mathematics, or a similar field with quantitative coursework, and 1-2 years of professional experience utilizing quantitative analysis is required, or a Master’s or PhD degree.
Must be comfortable working in industry standard statistics, analytics, and data visualization packages.
Must demonstrate strong initiative, interpersonal skills, and the ability to communicate effectively.

Top Candidates Will Also Have:

Bachelors, Masters, or PhD degree in Applied Statistics, Data Science, Business Analytics, Business Intelligence & Analytics, Computer Science, Computer Science + X, Engineering (Aerospace, Electrical, Mechanical, Computer, Industrial, Agricultural, etc.), Informatics, Information Systems Management, Mathematics, MBA with Technical Undergrad, Predictive Analytics, Statistics, or equivalent technical degree.
Experience with advanced data analysis and statistical methods such as regression, hypothesis testing, ANOVA, statistical process control, etc.
Practical applications of machine learning techniques such as Clustering, Logistic Regression, CART, Random Forests, SVM or Neural Networks.
Experience in design / development of heavy equipment (ex. automotive, aerospace, engine, transmission, construction, mining, industrial, etc)
Strong technical and problem-solving skills and evidence of continuous learning in the analytics field
2+ years of experience applying python (NumPy, SciPy, pandas, etc) programming to solve business challenges
Experience with cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, etc)
Strong initiative to research and apply new methods and digital technologies to exceed customer expectations.
Good communication, interpersonal, and collaboration skills 0-2 years experience.

Position’s Contributions to Work Group:

- Primary work:

- Supporting the MPI (Machine Parts Intelligence) snowflake datalab productionalization

[productionalization requires working with the IT group in order to take our SAS programs/output datasets and convert them into ‘IT owned production code/data tables’]

- Working closely with IT group to interpret and validate that the converted code/output datasets in production match our current datasets

- Required trainings to learn SAS, Snowflake, and SQL

- Required trainings to learn about the MPI program

- Candidate will be key contact from the IT group for questions on productionalization

- Secondary/Future work:

- This individual could eventually be supporting analytics-based research projects, data visualization (i.e., Power BI), and/or ad hoc data analysis in aftermarket parts inventory management. Potential to support Machine Learning based research projects.

- Team has clearly defined purpose and goals to support our aftermarket inventory management business through research/simulations/analytics. We create regular opportunities for open discussion and ideas. We support personal development and professional growth. There is a strong atmosphere of helping each other out and team mentorship is strong as well.

- Team Mission:

To revolutionize the approach to inventory management by leveraging innovative technologies and strategies. We aim to drive profitable growth by maximizing parts availability, ensuring optimal inventory levels, and improving efficiency. We are committed to continuous learning, adapting to changes, and leading the industry in innovative inventory solutions through the use of data science.

- Team Vision:

- Generate and explore new ideas to improve inventory planning

- Drive impactful results and decisions

- Use latest analytics techniques to solve business problems

- Attract the best talent and develop them into future Client leaders

Typical task breakdown:

- Candidate will need to work with our (research) team to learn SAS code/SQL/Snowflake and the MPI program

- Self-guided trainings will be required as needed.

- Requires detailed discussions and note taking to develop understanding of our current processes and what is MPI, etc.

- Regular meetings working together with MPI team in order to learn about program

- Data validation will become an important regular task.

- Eventually the candidate will become main contact between research team and the IT group to have MPI datalab productionalization moving forward to completion

Interaction with team:

- Hold Regular meetings with our team members

- Expected to coordinate setting up meetings with project team members pending on schedule and availability

- Required to interact with team on trainings

- Periodically will need to present updates to team and/or management on progress

Work environment:

- This position will require coming in the Morton A Office 3 days a week onsite, 2 days remote. Days in office TBD, but the schedule will need to be flexible to work with the current team.

Team is works well together as a group and always willing to help one another

Education & Experience Required:

- Bachelor’s degree in an Industrial Engineering, Supply Chain Management, Data Science, Business Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Business, or Related Degree Program with quantitative and technically challenging coursework with 0-2 years’ relevant experience.

- Minimum 2.8/4.0 Cumulative Grade Point Average (no rounding) at current institution.

Top Candidates:

- 1-2 years of experience in related field

- Knowledge of basic statistical approaches and/or data management techniques

Technical Skills:

(Required)

- Either Python or R or SQL, and/or related technical software

- Microsoft Office Products

(Desired)

- Experience with SAS and/or Snowflake (cloud data)

- Experience with Dataiku

- Experience Power BI or Tableau

- Utilizing machine learning models and/or deep learning (AI)

- Enthusiasm for big data processing, research, analytics, and problem solving

Soft Skills:

(Required)

- Demonstrates teamwork, initiative, and interpersonal skills

- Demonstrates the ability to communicate effectively verbally with PowerPoint

- Demonstrates the ability to effectively communicate concepts using data visualization, if needed

- Highly proficient written and verbal communication skills

(Desired)

- Demonstrates attention to detail

- Works well with others

- Good communication skills

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $40.00 - $44.00 per hour

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Experience:

Python: 2 years (Required)
SQL: 2 years (Required)
statistical approaches and/or data management techniques: 2 years (Required)
SAS: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: In person

The Argonne Leadership Facility (ALCF) in collaboration with Data Science and Learning (DSL) division, is looking for a postdoctoral appointee to perform research and development in high-performance computing techniques for large-scale X-ray image analysis problems in the context of the upcoming exascale platforms (Aurora) and upgraded Advanced Photon Source (APS-U).
In this role you can expect to:
Perform research and development in various HPC techniques, such as efficient usage of memory hierarchy and communication links (within an accelerator to across accelerators) and heterogeneous computing.
Collaborate with both computer and computational scientists from different divisions to understand upcoming APS-U imaging problems.
Conduct research and development aligned with Argonne’s strategic missions in computation.
Conduct work in HPC, parallel and distributed systems, computational imaging sciences, and leadership computing; and promotes findings through publications, presentations, program reports, software dissemination, and other means of reporting outcomes.
Contribute to the discovery and technological advances in X-ray imaging sciences via advanced HPC, parallel and distributed systems R&D, with emphasis on the applications of exascale (and beyond) computer architectures.
Strengthen your career path opportunities by applying new techniques, developing independent research capabilities, and building professional skills such as communication, networking, and leadership.
The high performance computing techniques will be implemented in an X-ray image analysis middleware/toolkit to ease the development of new, efficient, and scalable image processing algorithms with out-of-box HPC capabilities; and the software will be deployed to current and next-generation high-end compute clusters such as ALCF's Polaris, ThetaGPU, and Aurora.
Position Requirements
Required Skills:
Recent or soon-to-be completed PhD in related field (typically completed within the last three years) + 0-3 years of experience in computer science/engineering, computational imaging, or related field
Ability to model Argonne’s Core Values: Impact, Safety, Respect, Integrity, and Teamwork
Effective written and oral communication skills.
Ability to work individually and collaboratively as part of a team.

Preferred Skills:
Comprehensive knowledge in HPC, parallel and distributed computing, and systems programming.
Experience related to performance evaluation and tuning, communication and/or interconnect architectures.
Extensive expertise in multi-many-core systems, threading, and scientific application codes.
Job Family
Postdoctoral Family
Job Profile
Postdoctoral Appointee
Worker Type
Long-Term (Fixed Term)
Time Type
Full time

At GXO, we’re constantly looking for talented individuals at all levels who can deliver the caliber of service our company requires. You know that a positive work environment creates happy employees, which boosts productivity and dedication. On our team, you’ll have the support to excel at work and the resources to build a career you can be proud of.


As the Director, Revenue Data Science you are responsible for leading the build of data driven solutions to support pricing decisions. The ideal candidate should have a deep understanding of statistical modeling, data analysis and business acumen to identify opportunities of growth and optimization. You will drive the effectiveness and enablement of the pricing strategy that maximizes EBITDA and competitiveness across all business verticals. You will play a key role in developing pricing recommendations and guiding senior leadership in effective decision making. The role also provides visibility through cross-functional partnerships to a broad spectrum of functions at GXO. You will be part of a growing team of change managers to create a best in class go to market strategy.


Pay, benefits and more.

We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and more.




What you’ll do on a typical day:

Establish effective and competitive pricing strategies that maximize EBITDA across all business verticals.
Support the build of a data driven solution/platform to aid pricing/revenue related business decisions.
Own the logic to predict pricing effectiveness and ability to compete in the market for new business across all customer segments.
Develop rigorous, fact-based, quantitative analysis and modeling to provide insights and recommendations for future opportunities of growth and optimization. Ensure strategic and financial soundness and alignment for any recommendations.
Communicate compiled data analysis and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner. Create exec-facing dashboards and build business cases that drive decision making and business prioritization.
Collaborate with cross-functional leadership to identify, solution and implement opportunities for continuous improvement of the strategic pricing processes.

What you need to succeed at GXO:

At a minimum, you’ll need:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics or equivalent related work or military experience
7 years’ experience in data analytics, statistical modelling, or decision support
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or PowerBI
Proficiency in statistical software such as R or Python
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data analysis in a clear and concise manner
Familiarity with databases and data management systems such as SQL, predictive analytics tools

It’d be great if you also have:

Master’s degree in Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics or equivalent related work or military experience
Experience in supporting a system build for predictive analytics
Experience in pricing and costing within the Supply Chain or distribution industry
Experience working with enterprise scale databases, with demonstrated ability to independently query and prepare data for analysis
Operations Research, optimization, or linear programming exposure52424

Job Title: Postdoctoral Appointee - Mathematical Modeling of Solid-State Batteries
Job Description:
The Chemical Sciences and Engineering (CSE) Division is seeking a Postdoctoral Appointee, who under the guidance of a supervisor, conducts research on mathematical modeling of solid-state batteries. The project involves understanding and describing the interplay between the electrochemical and mechanical processes at metal-anode/solid-electrolyte and cathode/solid-electrolyte interfaces.
Successful candidate will develop computational models at the mesoscale or macroscale level using the principles of mass, momentum, and energy balance, to describe morphology changes, dendrite growth, side reactions, delamination processes etc. in hard and soft materials.
The successful candidate will collaborate extensively with experimental (electrochemical characterization, synchrotron analysis) and theoretical groups (specializing in atomistic simulations, DFT, AIMD) within Argonne National Lab, and other Labs and Universities in the US and across the world.
The successful candidate will be expected to develop mesoscale computational models, implement them, run simulations, analyze data, prepare manuscripts for submission to peer-reviewed journals, present papers at scientific meetings, and prepare reports, presentations, and papers for group meetings or meeting sponsor reporting requirements.
Position Requirements
Recently completed Ph. D Degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Materials Science, or Electrochemistry with 0 to 3 years of experience or equivalent
Deep understanding of electrochemistry, electrochemical engineering, and mechanical engineering
Strong skills of developing computational models using the principles of mass, momentum, and energy balance
Some experience in proposing, planning, and designing experiments
Considerable knowledge of processing, analyzing results, and formulating scientific problems
Considerable skill in written and oral communication
Proven desire to work in a team-based environment
Job Family
Postdoctoral Family
Job Profile
Postdoctoral Appointee
Worker Type
Long-Term (Fixed Term)
Time Type
Full time

Artificial Intelligence Business Development - NVIDIA Alliance

SFL Scientific, a Deloitte Business, is a U.S. based, data science consulting firm specializing in building industry-specific, artificial intelligence (AI) technologies. The practice brings together several key capabilities to develop and transform our clients' organizations through AI & Data Strategy. We are looking for an Artificial Intelligence Partnerships Leader to support the vision, strategy, and execution of our Artificial Intelligence go-to-market initiatives across industry sectors.

As part of our expanded strategic alliance with NVIDIA to unlock the value of generative AI across enterprise software platforms, we will help enterprises around the world use generative AI to reinvent how they conduct business. Deloitte will use NVIDIA AI technology and expertise to build high-performing generative AI solutions for enterprise software platforms to help unlock significant business value. We are working to enable generative AI business solutions, powered by the full stack of NVIDIA hardware and software, across each of the major enterprise platforms to enhance the value that businesses gain from these systems. These generative AI business solutions will span multiple use cases, including automated coding, self-configuration, workflow automation and industry-specific insights. Ultimately, Deloitte aims to democratize the usage and application of generative AI across enterprise systems and significantly enhance human potential.

Join us to expand your career through the lens of professional services and consulting and help create novel solutions to advance your AI & consulting career.

Work you'll Do

As the Artificial Intelligence Partnerships Leader you will be responsible for helping to identify, advocate, and execute Deloitte's interests across international and emerging organizations, with a specific focus on novel approaches in Generative AI, natural language processing, computer vision for imaging & autonomous systems, embedded & edge-AI, and other state-of-the-art capabilities. The individual is responsible for building the relationship between Deloitte, our alliance partners, and the client, helping architect novel AI solutions and capabilities to generate client impact, as well as planning and penetrating target technology areas and supporting AI integration and deployment.

The candidate will work with senior leaders within Deloitte and our alliance partners to craft and execute go-to-market strategies. The practice has a proven track record serving large, market-leading organizations in the private and public sectors, successfully delivering high-quality, novel and complex projects, offering deep domain, R&D, and scientific capabilities.

The Team

Our practice is focused on organizations making strategic choices to unlock new growth, elevate the customer experience, drive innovation, and enable competitive advantage. Deloitte's services and solutions provide actionable insights that enable our clients to formulate near- and long-term strategies to address their most pressing issues and provide a clear path for implementation.

Made up of experienced AI strategists, data scientists, and AI engineers, they serve as trusted advisors to executives, helping them understand and evaluate new and essential areas for AI investment and identify unique opportunities to transform their businesses.

Basic Qualifications:


Master's or Ph.D. preferred in STEM field, high proficiency in Artificial Intelligence, machine learning


3+ years of experience and a proven track record in shaping, selling, and delivering work in Artificial Intelligence


3+ years of experience utilizing NVIDIA GPU hardware and SDK packages


5+ years of previous experience traditional ML and deep learning techniques, AI integration strategy, and deployment tools and environments


6+ years of experience and excellent knowledge of digital tools and services, cloud environments, automation, and operational AI


5+ years of previous experience in managing technical or solutions teams and delivering complex AI/ML and analytics workloads


3+ years of experience in business and relationship development, proposal management and management of enterprise accounts or technical solutions in complex organizations


Live within commuting distance to one of Deloitte's consulting offices


Ability to travel 10% on average, based on the work you do and the clients and industries/sectors you serve


Limited immigration sponsorship may be available

Job Title: GenAI Specialist, AI/ML GTM Business Development
Job Description:
5+ years of developing, negotiating and executing business agreements experience
Experience influencing internal and external stakeholders
Experience managing programs across cross functional teams, building processes and coordinating release schedules
Are you energized to create new markets for Generative Artificial Intelligence (Gen AI), Machine Learning (ML), and Deep Learning (DL) technology? Do you love building new businesses?

AWS is seeking a Sr AI/ML GTM Business Development Specialist to define, build and lead the business development efforts at AWS to commercialize the AWS AI/ML platform. As a Sr AI/ML GTM Business Development Specialist you will be responsible for defining, building and deploying effective and targeted programs to accelerate broad based sales and business development activities for the AWS ML platform.

You will work directly with customers on a daily basis to help them select the right AWS AI/ML technologies. Your work will define and drive the process that the organization follows to accelerate sales and partner engagements of the AWS AI/ML portfolio in your region and you will synthesize data and information gathered from these customers and partners into the AWS GTM strategy for machine learning to successfully commercialize the platform in the local market. This entails deriving succinct findings, developing strategic insights, and persuasively communicating those findings and perspectives from customer engagements to product and sales teams, including senior management.

You will be the outward face of AWS AI/ML for a specific sector of the United States and will define and execute the market development activities for AI/ML services including Amazon SageMaker, Amazon Transcribe, Amazon Rekognition, Amazon Comprehend, and the bulk of the AWS AI/ML portfolio. You will leverage worldwide programs or campaigns and work closely with AWS Specialists for other technologies (Containers, Serverless, Analytics), sales, marketing, solutions architects, and partner teams, to position the AWS ML platform for customers and partners. You will also be helping AWS Sales become more comfortable with AI/ML use cases and technologies.

The ideal candidate will possess a business and machine learning or data analytics background, and will have a foundation of having directly driven customer engagements and interactions at the highest levels of large enterprises and technology partners. The candidate will have the technical depth and business experience to easily communicate the benefits of AI/ML services, platforms and frameworks in the AWS cloud to IT architects, engineering teams, and C-Level executives.

Additionally, the ideal candidate will have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and long-term in an ambiguous environment. The ideal candidate will be deeply familiar with complex legacy IT environments, managed enterprise IT infrastructure services, enterprise applications, and will have performed market analysis, deal negotiation and construction, field readiness, and business operations. Finally, the candidate will have a background that enables them to create scalable programs that apply holistic approaches to selling to enterprises and enterprise partners.

Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have twelve employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Atlanta, GA, USA | Austin, TX, USA | Chicago, IL, USA | Los Angeles, CA, USA | San Francisco, CA, USA


Experience interpreting data and making business recommendations
Experience developing, leading, negotiating and executing corporate and/or business transactions

About Northern Trust:
Northern Trust, a Fortune 500 company, is a globally recognized, award-winning financial institution that has been in continuous operation since 1889.
Northern Trust is proud to provide innovative financial services and guidance to the world’s most successful individuals, families, and institutions by remaining true to our enduring principles of service, expertise, and integrity. With more than 130 years of financial experience and over 22,000 partners, we serve the world’s most sophisticated clients using leading technology and exceptional service.

As our business grows, we are evolving better ways of consuming, producing, delivering and managing data to help ourselves and our clients to become more efficient in their Data Management Practices.

Our focus on data as a revenue generating stream within the Asset Servicing business has led us to expand our team in the Offensive data space and we are recruiting for a Head of Data Products (Global) -Asset Servicing reporting into the Chief Data Officer for Asset Servicing.

Offensive data is all about generating data products, data analytics and data services to support our customers in their business and be a leading part of the Northern Trust Asset Servicing product offering.

Key responsibilities include:
Define the data product roadmap, including the long-term vision and strategy for data products.
Identify market opportunities while analyzing user needs to prioritize and plan the development of data products.
Lead a high-performing data product team, providing guidance, mentorship, and support to ensure the team's success in delivering high-quality data products, while promoting a collaborative and innovative culture within the team.
Drive product development and delivery: Oversee the end-to-end product development lifecycle.
Support, challenge, and continually evolve our data strategy while defining our approach to data that will support the business in meeting its strategic priorities over time
Develop and build strategic relationships with external parties to ensure the definition and delivery of analytics is future-proofed and in line with industry best practices.
Encourage the entire business to be customer-focused and data-led to drive cultural change.
Set up a culture of knowledge-sharing across Northern Trust
Leverage Northern Trust’s data expertise to proactively challenge and influence internal and external stakeholders
Effectively drive cross-functional collaboration to ensure success in delivering the data strategy.
Work closely with the Chief Data Officer to drive efficiency and optimal effectiveness across the data department, agreeing on budgets, targets, and strategic data priorities.
Form a core part of the Data Leadership Team that is driving a rapid transformation towards a modern, product management-led approach to data, introducing notable modernity and a flexible, agile mindset across your team and internal relationships.

The successful candidate will benefit from having:
Experience and skills in building commercially productive data capabilities, be that in product generation of data sets and data domains for clients, the generation of AI (Artificial Intelligence) and ML (Machine Learning) capabilities or Data Services that disrupt the competitive landscape.
Prior experience working within Financial Services; preferably with experience in the Asset Servicing space
Proven track record of successful innovation and product launch
Prior experience in commercial pricing, modelling and revenue generation
Prior exposure or experience in the Data Management and the Data Products space
Proven experience in a delivery critical role
Proven experience in a role which requires networking, partnership building and credibility development internally and externally to an organisation
Demonstrated thought leadership through public speaking, sales pitches or demonstrations
Prior experience coaching and growing emerging team

Agency: Department of Public Health

This position is a union position; therefore, provisions of the relevant collective

employees should click the link near the top left to apply through the

Applications submitted via email or any paper manner (mail, fax, hand delivery) will not be considered.

Posting Identification Number 21-24-0103

Agency Marketing Statement
The Illinois Department of Public Health (IDPH) is tasked with the oversight of communities within
Illinois to achieve and maintain optimal health and safety. With an annual budget of over $600 million in state and federal funds, 7 regional offices, 3 laboratories and over 1,100 employees, IDPH is equipped to fulfill its mission of protecting the health and wellness of the people of Illinois through the prevention, health promotion, regulation and control of disease and injury.

Positive Overview
The Illinois Department of Public Health is seeking a highly motivated individual to serve as Data
Scientist for the Healthy Illinois program. Under direction of the Surveillance Data Manager, this position conducts a wide range of statistical and data science projects, engaging in statistical analysis, weighting, imputation, modeling, specifically small area estimation. This position will apply small area estimation models to survey data to generate health measures at various geographical levels. The measures will be used to summarize health data specific to cities, communities, local health departments, hospitals, and other small geographical groups. Additionally, this individual will develop effective data visualizations and other tools to communicate health data including annually publishing data for public access. Manages data requests and creates custom data reports for a variety of users. Consults with other programs within IDPH, other state agencies, local health departments, researchers, and public in matters related to Healthy Illinois.

Job Responsibilities
1. Manage datasets, analyzes, and summarizes data, in preparation for dissemination of data.
2. Performs complex data analysis via analytical software (SPSS, STATA, R, SAS or SUDAAN) software.
3. Assists the data analyst, producing data visualizations and summary reports for dissemination of data related to specific Healthy Illinois public health priorities.

4. Consults with the Department and with other agencies in matters related to using Healthy
Illinois data, serves as technical consultant in projects involving Healthy Illinois data and preparation of special reports, graphical presentations, analyses, monographs, and publications.

5. Confers with other surveillance team staff to develop and determine new techniques for surveillance; researches techniques to standardize the methodology of the research and analysis, interpretation and reporting of health statistics data.

6. Performs other duties as required or assigned which are reasonably within the scope of the duties enumerated above.

Minimum Qualifications
Requires knowledge, skill and mental development equivalent to completion of four years of college with courses in statistics, computer science, mathematics, economics and related fields.
Requires four years of professional experience in applied epidemiology, bio-statistics, or in population, or a related research field.

Preferred Qualifications
Three years of experience performing analysis using SPSS, STATA, R, SAS or SUDAAN software.
One year of professional experience creating data visualizations with tools such as Tableau,
Power BI, or ArcGIS.
Two years of experience with statistical techniques and their application to health data.
Two years of experience with the development and application of research techniques.
Two years of research experience working with public health data.
One year of experience interpretating and communicating statistical data for presentations and reports.
One year of experience collaborating in a team environment.

Job Title: Data Scientist – Global Planning & Analytics, Analytics & Insights
Job Description:
Overview:

Talented and motivated individual who will be part of a group of skilled analytic resources to develop descriptive, diagnostic, predictive business solutions and deliver actionable insights to our internal and external customers.
The person will be responsible for applying cutting edge analytics to solve our clients’ complex problems in areas such as promotions, supply and demand planning, item/menu level analytics, supply chain simulations and optimization, competitive benchmarking, and root cause analysis.
The role will involve developing advanced analytic solutions in a modular way to ensure extensibility, scalability, and agility.
This will involve keeping up to date with the latest advances in data and analytics, which will then be used to inform the solution strategy. Ensuring high quality of the deliverables will be an essential part of this role.
This role provides the opportunity to shape our thinking on how analytic solutions are designed, developed, and delivered. The person must be able to synthesize data into actionable insights and promote data driven strategies, drive thought leadership, and help build a trusted partnership with stakeholders.
Be current on trends and developments in the market with an eye on bringing in new advancements into our portfolio of solutions.
This role will be part of the Global Planning & Analytics, Analytics and Insights team.
Responsibilities:
WHAT YOU WILL DO


Responsible for working with the Data & Operations, Innovation & Optimization and Integrated Planning teams to design and implement advanced algorithms to solve supply chain problems such demand and supply planning, replenishment, pricing and optimization
Create, develop, and implement innovative approaches to address the most relevant supply chain issues in the food service industry
Design and implement modular and scalable Data Science solutions with diagnostic, predictive and predictive capabilities that can be leveraged across product families
Monitor and adapt models to changing business needs
Working with Technology to ensure that any new solution is consistent and aligned with agreed architecture and infrastructure
Perform descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive analysis
Be an analytics translator to various levels of the organization and as an owner of complex analytics modules
Codify the appropriate analytic capabilities in a reusable and scalable manner to enable ease of consumption by other analytics developers
Act as a trusted advisor on machine learning, AI and statistical methods; enable other team members to solve complex data science problems, including problem formulation, data preparation, model development, and output interpretation


Desired Skills & Experience:
ABOUT YOU

Qualification
Bachelor’s degree in data science, analytics, statistics, operations research, engineering or closely related field; Master’s or Ph. D in quantitative field preferred.

Knowledge and Experience
3+ years of data science, analytics, business intelligence experience with Bachelor’s degree
Strong background in Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence and advanced statistical methods
Strong experience building and implementing ML/AI, statistical and simulation models
Strong experience in building scalable and maintainable Data Science/analytics solutions in Python
Comfortable handling large volumes as well as less than perfect data
Experience with advanced analytic and BI tools such as PowerBI and Tableau
Skilled in problem solving, data mining and analysis in a business setting
Domain knowledge in food service, restaurant operations, demand planning, supply planning, distribution and logistics a plus
Benefits:

TOTAL REWARDS

Our total rewards philosophy integrates programs for compensation, benefits, recognition, learning and development, corporate culture, corporate citizenship and work-life balance. While individual program components may differ by country, some things remain constant:

our commitment to rewarding results
opportunities to work with talented and driven individuals at every level of our company who respect each other, treat each other fairly and hold one another accountable for our customers’—and our company’s—success

There's more ...

inclusive employee resource groups
generous medical, dental, vision and other great benefits
paid parental and medical leave programs
401(k) with a company match component and profit sharing

Hybrid work model with flexibility
tuition reimbursement and student loan repayment assistance

We consider a number of factors when making individual compensation decisions including, but not limited to, skill sets, experience and training, and other business needs. Position Summary:
The Data Scientist is part of a Global Data and Analytics Center of Excellence, which provides design, development, consulting, and support services to various international markets. The Data Scientist will analyze data to identify relevant patterns and trends that can be leveraged to improve our business. Using these insights, the role will develop and implement advanced analytics solutions that deliver significant cost savings and/or drive new business opportunities for the organization.
Position Responsibilities may include, but not limited to: predictive models, AI/ML, streaming, Azure, Snowflake, Power BI, Spark, R, Python, Scala, SPSS, SAS, business intelligence, analytics, data science
Build and use business subject matter expertise around domains of data through heavy collaboration with business subject matter experts. Develop a thorough understanding of business challenges and business opportunities that can be addressed through analytics solutions
Determine valuable data sources and consolidate data from multiple sources into comprehensive datasets
Apply advanced statistical analysis to discover patterns and trends in large and complex datasets that can be used to uncover key business insights
Develop advanced statistical models, using appropriate statistical techniques and analytics tools and technologies such as Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence
Work in accordance with an iterative development process that allows for continual refinement and validation of analytics solutions
Present relevant analytical insights to business and project teams and make informed proposals for how to properly interpret and use this information
Identify appropriate technical approaches and tools to build and execute models
Work closely with other business and technical teams to operationalize and integrate analytical solutions into existing business and customer-facing applications
Balance the constraints of cost, time, and quality to deliver viable and practical solutions

At HCSC, we consider our employees the cornerstone of our business and the foundation to our success. We enable employees to craft their career with curated development plans that set their learning path to a rewarding and fulfilling career.

Come join us and be part of a purpose driven company who is invested in your future!

Job Summary

We’re looking for a Lead Data Science Product Manager in our Data Science & AI Solutions organization. We have many different domains (or thematic units) within this organization, with topics that include Claims, Member Engagement, Utilization Management, Quality, Risk Stratification, Foundational, and AI Innovation Lab. The work of each domain is generally led by 1 (or sometimes 2) Product Managers, who engage senior and executive leadership in the domain area to understand their most significant business challenges, design new data science products and solutions to automate or enable better decision making to address these challenges, build long-term product roadmaps, scale and deliver on those products by working within cross-functional data science, IT, and business teams, and provide overall product leadership for one or more of our machine learning and AI initiatives. Successful candidates will also have indirect leadership over data scientists and engineers assigned to these initiatives. This is an exciting opportunity to lead the adoption of AI to transform one of HCSC’s core capabilities and drive tremendous impact for our customers and members.

At the largest customer-owned and not-for-profit health insurer and fourth largest health insurer overall in the United States, you will have the opportunity to work with massive datasets to drive revenue growth, improve our operational and member-facing processes, and affect how healthcare is delivered to our 17 million members.

An ideal candidate is someone who has a demonstrated track record of leading or delivering analytical projects and products with measurable value, can see the big picture and effectively communicate with executives, has an ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences, and has a laser-focused customer and user-centric mindset.
Note that while this position requires an understanding of data science, machine learning, and AI and its applications, it is not a technical role. We are looking for a business person who has a strong technical background that can lead and indirectly influence both IT and business teams to scale and deploy models in a complex organizational environment.

Job Purpose:
Serves as the business interface of the team to deliver predictive / prescriptive analytics, as well as descriptive reports / dashboards, as needed; accountable for the operationalization of data science solutions.

Required Job Qualifications:

Bachelor degree and 5 years of work experience in a mathematical, statistical, computer science, engineering, physics, economics or related quantitative field OR Actuarial credential or Master degree and 4 years of work experience in an advanced mathematical, statistical , engineering, physics or related quantitative field OR Ph.D. and 2 years of work experience in a mathematical, statistical, computer science, engineering, physics, economics or related quantitative field OR 8 years of work experience in an advanced mathematical, statistical , engineering, physics or related quantitative field
Must demonstrate proficiency in at least four of the following six areas: 1) data analysis and relational-style query languages; 2) machine learning and/or statistical modeling; 3) data visualization; 4) a high-level programming language; 5) distributed computing; 6) understanding of healthcare.
Strong learning and growth mindset
Customer-focused
Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
A track record of independently delivering or leading the delivery of multiple complex analytics or data science projects with measurable value

Preferred Job Qualifications:

Previous product management experience
Previous experience working with insurance claims systems or applications
Experience with Iterative / Agile / Scrum development

Position Purpose: Analyze integrated and extensive datasets to extract value, which directly impacts and influences business decisions. Work collaboratively with key business stakeholders to identify areas of value, develop solutions, and deliver insights to reduce overall cost of care for members and improve their clinical outcomes.

Interpret and analyze data from multiple sources including healthcare provider, member/patient, and third-party data.
Contribute to the planning and execution of large-scale projects with limited direction from leadership
Assist in the design, testing, and implementation of process enhancements and identify opportunities for automation
Identify and perform root-cause analysis of data irregularities and present findings and proposed solutions to leadership and/or customers
Manage multiple, variable tasks and data review processes with limited supervision within targeted timelines
Apply expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how customers interact with analytic products
Partner cross-functionally at all levels of the organization and effectively, both verbally and visually, communicate findings and insights to non-technical business partners
Independently engage with customers and business partners to gather requirements and validate results
Communicate and present data-driven insights and recommendations to both internal and external stakeholders, soliciting and incorporating feedback when required
Provide technical guidance to junior analysts

Working knowledge of SQL/querying languages. Preferred knowledge of programmatic coding languages such as Python and R. Knowledge of statistical, analytical, or data mining techniques including basic data modeling, trend analysis, and root-cause analysis preferred. FinancExperience in Finance, Actuarial Science, or Accounting preferred. Experience using analytic techniques & tools to explore financial performance trends and/or reconciling financial data preferred.

Fraud, Waste & Abuse: Experience in fraud/waste/abuse identification and investigation, provider billing, or clinical coding preferred; Experience with data mining, machine learning, artificial intelligence, or statistical modeling preferred

Quality: Experience with HEDIS, NCQA, Medicare Star Rating System, QRS, or other quality measures preferred; Quality auditing or analysis of call center performance preferred; Experience with data mining, population health, and statistical modeling preferred

Tools & Technology: Experience with report/dashboard development, data/report automation, self-service capabilities, data design and integration, or data quality and governance preferred

Regional and HBR Analytics: Experience in emerging trend analysis, financial modeling, claims pricing, contract/network analysis, and/or ROI evaluation preferred. Job Title: Technical Solutions Architect - Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence - Tax Technology
Job Description:
EY focuses on high-ethical standards and integrity among its employees and expects all candidates to demonstrate these qualities. At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.


Location: Chicago, Atlanta, Alpharetta, Nashville, Dallas, San Antonio, Philadelphia


As part of our Americas Tax Technology Group (ATTG) you will be part of a technology organization that develops and maintains innovative solutions for our client-serving Tax professionals. ATTG professionals will partner with our Tax professionals to develop supporting technology such as digital/mobile tools to improve internal operations, application of Robotics Process Automation (RPA) to collect financial data, development of advanced financial dashboards, visualization, analytics, and reports.


The Solutions Architect role is in the Architecture and Standards pillar. The main function of this pillar is to set the standards for ATTG's Architecture and Tax Data strategies.


Essential Functions of the Job:

Ensures the architecture of solutions is aligned with the direction of organization in terms of technology and business strategy.
Drives effective decision making to steer, harmonize and accelerates efforts within Portfolio.
Accountable for the solution architecture of all products within the SSL portfolio.
Ensures the direction and implementation of a solution is true to its design, and if a change is required, it is managed appropriately.
Makes an informed Build vs. Buy decision by consistently following NTI process and applying systematic approach to technology evaluation.
Routes technology purchase requests through appropriate channels to ensure alignment with Global Procurement purchasing requirements.
Ensures that the solution design specifies technologies & tools that have been approved for use by Tax Quality, Risk Management & Independence.
Collaborate with SDL and BTL to devise Solution Delivery Strategy.
Assists with mapping of the business technology strategy to a solution strategy.
Participate in rationalization on the latest trends in the market, available at ATTG/ GTP capabilities and offerings.
Facilitates preparation of potential technical solutions and advises SDL and BTL on the technical and business value of the proposition.
Promote growth, innovation, and long-term profitability concepts
Develops standards that typically include best practices observed from other technology rollouts and helping develop solutions faster through repeatable actions or reusable components in new designs.
Identifies programs to deliver Architectural leverage and scale through reusable components.
Works alongside governance bodies in ATTG to form part of the organization’s overall governance picture.
Architects self-service of products and services with minimal human intervention in deployment and operation.
Ensures that governance is met through automation and policy enforcement to reduce manual process gates
Ensures compliance to the standards for solution architecture and integration of the relevant building blocks already available
Defines a robust architecture for building new applications and releases, leveraging and enhancing existing building blocks, or creating new reusable components
Drives the organization towards best practices and technologies such as Agile/DevOps, Big Data/Analytics, AI, Microservices
Partners with others inside and outside SSL and ATTG organization to gather all requirements to formulate the appropriate architecture required to provide system functionality, deciding when to advocate, and when to compromise, to arrive at a mutually-acceptable solution
Works closely with the Studio teams to translate the efforts into value

Analytical/Decision Making Responsibilities:

Ability to clearly articulate both problems and proposed solutions
Proactive approach to identifying issues and presenting solutions and options, and where appropriate, leading to resolution
Understand the long-term business objectives and suggest technical strategies to meet those objectives by introducing innovation through technology

Knowledge and Skills Requirements:

Must have experience working with various architectural styles and patterns
Comfortable communicating architecture to all levels of management and customers
Responsive and decisive on adjusting our product architecture per customer requirements, market conditions and technology evolution
Excellent knowledge of software development methodologies and processes
Track record that includes the design and release of high-quality, high-performance, enterprise-level software products/applications
Excellent decision-making skills with the ability to balance conflicting interests in a complex and fast-paced environment
Strong analytical, prioritization, and troubleshooting skills
Strong leadership skills and experience successfully managing teams
Work and communicate internally and with the customer at all levels, including engineers, end-users to C-suite
Experience with designing and implementing hybrid cloud solutions
Architectural experience including use of UML and other Case tools
Strong experience in ability to document concepts and designs for C-level consumption
Working experience in Business Architecture

Supervision Responsibilities:

Works with limited direction & oversight
Provides Supervision & direction to team members & staff

Other Requirements:

Occasional overnight travel may be required.

Job Requirements:

A bachelor's degree (computer science, engineering, accounting, finance preferred) or equivalent work experience.
Master's degree preferred
10+ years of experience



What we offer
We offer a comprehensive compensation and benefits package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to the business. The salary range for this job in most geographic locations in the US is $76,700 to $175,000. The salary range for New York City Metro Area, Washington State and California (excluding Sacramento) is $92,000 to $198,900. Individual salaries within those ranges are determined through a wide variety of factors including but not limited to education, experience, knowledge, skills and geography. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options. Under our flexible vacation policy, you’ll decide how much vacation time you need based on your own personal circumstances. You’ll also be granted time off for designated EY Paid Holidays, Winter/Summer breaks, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

EY | Building a better working world
EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.
Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Overview:

The Manager of Business Intelligence is responsible for directing and overseeing the Business Intelligence Strategic Plan and roadmap in support of all enterprise reporting and analytics that drives insight to action.




This position facilitates organizational data strategies for governance, design, implementation, integration and usage. Makes tactical decisions related to business intelligence tools and applications:

Focuses on defining and enforcing best practices and agreed upon standardization, as well as evaluating requests for exceptions. Manages a team of Business Intelligence (BI) Engineers team to bring meaningful business insights to the organization from multiple, disparate data sources. Directs the evaluation of new Business Intelligence / Data Warehouse products. Sets policies, standards and best practices for Business Intelligence. Works across departments to prioritize data development needs and communicate project performance results to company leadership.

Responsibilities:
Builds a cohesive BI strategy and roadmap for the organization, aligning with business priorities and opportunities in support of the vision to transform the company into a business that can compete on an information and analytics level.
Manages strategic, tactical and operational technical responsibilities associated with BI functional areas such as data governance, reporting analytics, big data, Artificial Intelligence, and Machine Learning.
Leads the Data Governance Community of Practice by collaborating with data stewards, technology and business stakeholders.
Serves as the product owner for data discovery and data cataloging tools and workflows - championing best practices, data definitions and issue resolution across multiple teams and systems.
Lead the BI team by executing a vision for the delivery of information and analytics platforms and solutions to the business’s key stakeholders. Manages, mentors, motivates and build a team of BI data analysts and Data Architects that drive excellence in delivery.
Develops enterprise data quality management programs and tools.
Develops data training/data literacy programs to drive a data culture across the organization.
Manages BI infrastructure and licenses, ensuring high availability, performance and access to all users required skills.
Stays abreast of modern BI technology and works with the BI team to lay a roadmap for BI direction.
Provide an analysis to upper management and drive a business case to develop Analytics solutions within existing systems that will help streamline and reduce costs.
This position is a senior leader position that requires continual technical knowledge and growth in the areas of Business Intelligence, Artificial Intelligence, Big Data and Machine Learning.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or other related field OR equivalent work experience. Master’s Degree (MIS or MBA) recommended or PMP.
Must have at least 7 years of BI Manager experience.
Must have at least 7 years working with any business intelligence tool such as, Tableau, or Power BI.
Must have experience in managing and developing Business Intelligence Methodologies.
Must be proficient with the Microsoft Business Intelligence Semantic Model (BISM). This includes knowledge of Power BI, Power Pivot, Tabular and Molap Cubes.
Must have knowledge of Power BI architecture which includes, the Tabular model, Role Level Security (RLS) in Power BI, Embedded Power BI implementation architecture and interaction with Web Applications.
Must be able to generate data models using either Kimball or Inmon enterprise data modeling.
Must have experience with SSIS when utilized with ETL (Type 1 and Type 2) dimensions.
Excellent written and verbal communication Proficient in developing detailed requirement specifications, system documentation, workflow procedures, and data modeling documentation. Communicates system changes and issues to both business sponsors and IT staff.
Works independently or as a part of a team to support cross-team architecture requirements.
Ability to mentor/coach all levels of staff.
Proficient at taking a project from inception to completion including project planning, status reporting, requirements gathering, design, coding, testing and implementation of a quality product.
Ability to prepare effective presentations including meeting facilitation.
Exhibits strong problem-solving skills and resourcefulness. Uses expertise to identify and analyze problems and assess potential issues to improve applications in a timely manner.
Knowledge of Business Intelligence technology trends and directions and can provide the best solution to any problem.
Ability to understand and utilize Cube and Pivot technology.
Competent in understanding complex data models.
Note: Successful applicants for domestic positions that require travel to a customer site must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment.

Duties and Responsibilities
Summary
The Department of Health Informatics and Data Science and the Center for Health Outcomes and Informatics Research (CHOIR) at Loyola University Chicago invites applications for two immediate postdoctoral research positions opening in medical informatics for a one-year tenure. We are encouraging applicants with strong research background in data science, machine learning, or natural language processing with a focus on biomedical applications.

Expectations
The selected candidate will work with Dr. Tootooni to conceptualize research studies, design methods and modeling, perform data analysis, attend/present at international conferences, and draft manuscripts (papers and proposals). This is an excellent opportunity for junior scientists to engage in hands-on programming, applying artificial intelligence to healthcare practice, and to thrive in multi-institutional collaborative projects with esteemed scholars. Dr. Tootooni’s lab comprises a diverse group of twelve members, including students, analysts, biostatisticians, and research assistants. This multicultural team represents various educational levels from undergraduate students to postdoctoral researchers, promoting a dynamic and inclusive learning environment. This aligns with Loyola’s mission to foster an academic community valuing social justice and respecting the dignity of all members. Particularly for candidates aiming for an academic career in health or biomedical informatics, this position offers the chance to collaborate with top scientists and clinicians from institutions like the Mayo Clinic, Wake Forest School of Medicine, Loyola University Medical Center, and the University of Illinois at Chicago.

This is a one-year postdoctoral research position, extendable annually based on budget availability and performance. Interested individuals should submit the required application materials (C.V., 1-page letter of interest, and contacts of three references) Only candidates who apply through the LUC portal will be considered. For inquiries about the position, please email Dr. Samie Tootooni at mtootooni@luc.edu. We will review applications until the position is filled. Applications will be evaluated as they are received and completed. The anticipated start date is January 1, 2024 or until the position is filled.
Other duties as assigned.

Preferred candidates have experience working with Electronic Health Records (EHR) data and health ontologies such as ICD and UMLS.

Advanced knowledge in computer programming (preferably R or Python), machine learning, deep learning, natural language processing, and applied statistics is required.

Company Description


Read this first: If you have what it takes for this job, but don't meet all the criteria within the job description, we encourage you to apply. We'd like to connect with you to see what skills and experience you could bring to our team.

The Publicis Media Technology group is a centralized practice within Publicis Media, the media-centric solutions hub of Publicis Groupe [Euronext Paris FR0000130577, CAC 40]. PM Technology drives transformation across Publicis Media’s agency brands via the provision of a scalable and consistent approach to data and technology. PM Technology is powered by a leading, data/tech platform; best-in-class technology management and consultancy services; unified workflow solutions; differentiated products and client solution stacks; and strategic oversight of all major data and technology partnerships. Home to over 100 engineers, data architects, consultants, product managers and a robust project management operation, PM Technology helps scale innovation worldwide.



Job Description


An engineer with a focus on Machine Learning and LLM based development. Responsible for the development, implementation, and on-going support of ML models. Should have experience Python and experience integrating models into existing architectures in cloud environments using and developing APIs.

Should have deep knowledge of and experience with Machine Learning and AI concepts and be able to articulate differences between them as well as data requirements that they may have. Particularly the candidate should have knowledge of LLM and prompt engineering. Should understand the flow of data and be able to extract/clean data, into appropriate structures, to train models. Should understand synchronous and asynchronous data pipelines and training methodologies and help guide a data engineering team to the best solution.

Key Responsibilities:

Design and develop ML AI models to use NLP to solve business challenges.
Worked with LLMs and integrated with APIs. I.e. Open AI, Hugging Face etc,
Knowledge of recent developments in ML and LLMs,
Experience with embeddings and vector search platforms. I.e. Pinecone, etc
Experience of prompt engineering and using augmented data with LLMs,
Work closely with Dev Lead and Architect and other data providers to ensure implementation follows best practices.
Able to build and deploy models and work with DevOps to automate processes.
Analyze data for trends and patterns, and interpret data with clear objectives in mind.
Research and leverage new NLP/ML innovations to keep up to industry developments.
Experience of comparing effectiveness of models and making recommendations for model improvements or alternative techniques


Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science or equivalent required, with master’s degree preferred.
At least 3 years of experience in building AI related models using, Python, or equivalent.
Expertise in different model architectures, specifically Time Series models, Variational Auto Encoders, LLMs.
Proficiency in ML techniques around Anomaly Detection, generative models and NLP.
Experience of Python and associated ML and DS libraries.
Experience with Data pipelining and preprocessing strategies.
Experience with NLP services and knowledge of Prompt Engineering and Embeddings.
Understanding of pipeline automation and monitoring.
Understanding of data security and compliance.
Database knowledge, especially MSSQL Server.
Ability to quickly understand complex consumer behavior and businesses concepts, including financial, operational, and strategic aspects.
Communication and interpersonal skills; ability to work in team environment; experience in communicating with client stakeholders and senior leadership on complex topics.
Advanced knowledge of relational database concepts with ability to perform complex queries in a SQL Server environment.

Additional Information


Publicis Media provides benefits and resources designed to support all of our employees. With comprehensive health and dental benefits, 401K match program, generous time off, and flexibility to work remotely we strive to support work life balance. We encourage participation in the over 13 Business Resource Groups, including groups for Women, People of Color, Veterans, LGTBQ community and allies, Parents, and more.
